{"step_by_step_thinking": "Infection of the masticatory space is usually associated with a mandibular molar. According to the documents, odontogenic infections, particularly those originating from the mandibular molars, can spread to the masticatory space. The masticatory space is a deep facial space that contains the muscles of mastication, including the masseter and medial pterygoid muscles. Infections from the mandibular molars can spread upward into the masticatory space, leading to symptoms such as trismus (difficulty opening the mouth) and swelling in the region of the masseter muscle. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Mandibular molar.", "answer_choice": "B"}
